page.title: 02VISITING TILMANSTONE
page.content: Entering from the west, along{School {road}and past{Dane Court,}there are some of the older houses in the vil_ lage.{Old School, Laundry}and{Golden {Bell Cottages}are converted to pretty, private homes. On leaving School road you see the Saxon{Parish church}of St.Andrews, past which lies{North Court.}Turn right to reach the centre of the vil_ lage which comprises a development of new houses, tastefully blended into their rural setting; the{Ravens pub, pleasant and recently extended, behind which stands the{Forge cottage,}now the only thatched house in Tilmanstone village. Continuing on you pass the former {Vicarage,}now a pleasant{residential {home}for the elderly, the{Village Hall and{Post Office/General Store.}The {Plough & Harrow pub}is on the A256.
